title: Parametric Circles and Lines - atypical interval

content.question: Which of the following is a parametrization of the arc of the unit circle in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane from <math alttext="open parentheses 0 comma negative 1 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> to <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, moving counterclockwise as <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> increases from <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses equals open parentheses cos open parentheses pi over 4 t close parentheses comma sin open parentheses pi over 4 t close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses equals open parentheses cos open parentheses pi over 4 open parentheses t minus 2 close parentheses close parentheses comma sin open parentheses pi over 4 open parentheses t minus 2 close parentheses close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses equals open parentheses cos open parentheses pi t close parentheses comma sin open parentheses pi t close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses equals open parentheses cos open parentheses pi open parentheses t minus 2 close parentheses close parentheses comma sin open parentheses pi open parentheses t minus 2 close parentheses close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses equals open parentheses cos open parentheses pi over 4 open parentheses t minus 2 close parentheses close parentheses comma sin open parentheses pi over 4 open parentheses t minus 2 close parentheses close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
